questions.text: Is climate action the core purpose or goal of the policy?
questions.answer: The core purpose of the policy, as outlined in the Climate Change Adaptation Plan, is indeed climate action. The policy aims to enable people, businesses, infrastructure, and the environment to adapt to an increasingly variable and volatile climate. The plan sets out priority risks and action areas for the next ten years, including those relevant to the community and council operations. The objectives of the plan include leading the community and businesses to build resilience and proactively consider climate risk, and working with key financial partners to increase consideration of climate risk. The policy also outlines specific adaptation actions, such as facilitating improved community resilience, developing an Integrated Water Plan, and investigating modification of construction practices for road and council infrastructure. Each action includes details of relevant risks, timelines, action ownership, resources required, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
